'''David Victor Hinkley''' is a [[statistician]] known for his research in [[statistical model]]s and [[statistical inference|inference]] and for his graduate-level books.

==Research and graduate textbooks==
He earned a PhD from the [[Imperial College London]] under the supervision of [[David R. Cox]]. In 1974 Hinkley and Cox published a textbook on statistical inference, of unusual breadth and conceptual interest.

Hinkley has also collaborated with [[Bradley Efron]], in particular on writing a paper on [[maximum likelihood|maximizing]] the [[likelihood_function#Conditional_likelihood|conditional likelihood function]] and on using the [[observed information|observed]] [[Fisher information]].<ref>{{cite journal
 |last1=Efron   |first1=B.   |authorlink1=Bradley Efron
 |last2=Hinkley |first2=D.V. <!-- |authorlink2=David V. Hinkley -->
 |year=1978

 |journal=[[Biometrika]]
 |volume=65 |issue=3 |pages=457–487
 |doi=10.1093/biomet/65.3.457 |mr=0521817 | jstor = 2335893
}}</ref>

===Bootstrapping===
Hinkley is one of the world's foremost experts on [[bootstrapping (statistics)|bootstrapping]], a method of [[computational statistics]], which is largely due to [[Bradley Efron]].  With Anthony C. Davison, Hinkley wrote a text on bootstrapping; their text, "Davison-Hinkley", is widely used and referenced.<ref>Davison, A. C.; Hinkley, D. (2006). ''Bootstrap Methods and their Application'' (8th printing). Cambridge: Cambridge Series in Statistical and Probabilistic Mathematics.]</ref>

==Positions and awards==

Hinkley has been professor at the [[University of Minnesota]], Departments of Applied Statistics and Theoretical Statistics, at the University of Austin, Texas, and at the University of Oxford, U.K.
He currently is a professor of statistics at the [[University of California at Santa Barbara]] Department of Statistics.<ref>[http://www.pstat.ucsb.edu/faculty%20pages/Hinkley.htm Faculty webpage]</ref>

In 1984 Hinkley received the [[COPSS Presidents' Award]].''<ref>[http://www.imstat.org/awards/copss_recipients.htm COPPS Awards – Recipients].</ref>
